actions.text: Amendment SA 65 as modified agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

Amendment SA 65 proposed by Senator Coburn to Amendment SA 26. (consideration: CR S1976, S1984-1985) To prohibit the use of funds to carry out the functions of the Political Science Program in the Division of Social and Economic Sciences of the Directorate for Social, Behavioral, and Economic Sciences of the National Science Foundation, except for research projects that the Director of the National Science Foundation certifies as promoting national security or the economic interests of the United States.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 65 as modified agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 65 proposed by Senator Coburn to Amendment SA 26.

amends_amendment.purpose: In the nature of a substitute.

purpose: To prohibit the use of funds to carry out the functions of the Political Science Program in the Division of Social and Economic Sciences of the Directorate for Social, Behavioral, and Economic Sciences of the National Science Foundation, except for research projects that the Director of the National Science Foundation certifies as promoting national security or the economic interests of the United States.
